header.title: The Scroll of Set - Issue Number 71

central_thesis: The Temple of Set provides a structured yet individually-focused path for self-transformation (Setamorphosis/Xeper) through its hierarchical degrees, specialized Orders, and integration of magical knowledge into daily life. It presents a critical view of humanity's collective psychological stagnation and offers a distinct approach to achieving ultimate individual perfection within the 'Darkness' of its philosophy.

structure_content.summary: This article by Dennis K. Mann III° advocates for the practical integration of magical knowledge into daily life. It emphasizes continuous learning through engagement with books, articles, and past issues of The Scroll, treating them as essential resources for Setian development. It lists specific past articles considered stimulating or valuable for magical benefit and wisdom, highlighting the importance of a broad, non-compartmentalized approach to magical education.

Amn DeCecco IV° argues that humanity has psychologically stagnated, collectively remaining at a 17-year-old equivalent, despite technological advances. He posits that true 'crowning of the skull' (ultimate development) has not been achieved by mankind. The article advocates for a select few to pursue 'ultimate perfection' not by 'being man' or 'aiming for God,' but by creating an enduring aspect of themselves within the 'Darkness' – a process conceptually distinct from conventional humanity.

structure_content.chapter_title: [3] Orders Within the Temple of Set
structure_content.summary: Michael A. Aquino VI° formalizes guidelines for establishing and operating specialized Orders within the Temple of Set. These Orders, led by IV°+ Grand Masters, cater to specific interests and may have their own initiatory/ritual procedures, subordinate to the Temple's system. Membership is typically for II°+ Setians, with III°s encouraged to prioritize general Temple responsibilities. Orders must contribute to the Temple as a whole, allow for free visitation (with exceptions), and not conflict with basic ethical guidelines. The Order of the Trapezoid is given 'first among equals' status.
A brief announcement of Linda Reynolds' re-entry into the Temple of Set as a Priestess of Set III°.

This section introduces the 'Inter-Member Communication Roster' as a new initiative to help I°/II° Setians connect with others at similar levels of initiation. It details the process for inclusion (name, phone, interests, age, sex, marital status optional) and how to contact others on the roster, emphasizing that direct street/city addresses will not be shared, with initial contact facilitated through the Temple office.

Peggy J. Payne I° expresses a deeply personal and poetic account of transformation within the Black Arts. She describes a process of becoming an 'Infernal beast' and 'magnificent being of omnipotent powers,' embracing the 'Darkness' and union with 'the Devil' (Set). The piece conveys an insatiable hunger for 'deadly secrets of truth' and the 'exquisite torment' of this transformational ordeal.

key_concepts.definition: An adherent of the Temple of Set, actively engaged in its philosophy and practices of self-transformation.
The process of individual psychological and spiritual transformation for adherents of Set, aimed at expansive intellect and self-perfection, distinct from conventional human development.
A core Setian concept of self-creation and becoming, mentioned in the context of 'Feldenkraisian Xeper' as a means of personal transformation.
The specific magical and philosophical focus of the Temple of Set, implying practices aimed at individual self-empowerment and transcendence beyond conventional human limitations.

Specialized, internally oriented groups within the Temple of Set, each with distinct interests, initiatory procedures, and a IV°+ Grand Master, designed to enhance individual initiatory quests without restricting the Temple's overall system.
A conceptual space or state outside of mankind's limitations where ultimate perfection and creation can take place, built from internal forces and distinct from humanity.

The hierarchical structure of initiation within the Temple of Set: Initiate (I°), Adept (II°), Priest/Priestess (III°), and Grand Master (IV°+), each with increasing responsibilities and prerequisites for Order membership or leadership.

practical_system.description: The Temple of Set offers a structured system for individual self-perfection through the 'Black Arts,' encouraging members to integrate magical knowledge into all aspects of life. This involves active study of Setian philosophy, historical documents (like past Scroll issues), and engaging with specialized 'Orders' that cater to specific magical or philosophical interests. Advancement occurs through distinct initiatory degrees (I°, II°, III°, IV°+), each with specific responsibilities and contributions expected. The system emphasizes personal transformation, transcending conventional human limitations, and operating within a framework that balances individual quest with organizational support.
tools: Specialized Orders (as frameworks for practice and study)
rituals: Rituals Without Chambers (concept of non-physical or internal ritual work)

relevant_quotes.text: Do not make the mistake of taking your magical knowledge and compartmentalizing it from your day-to-day acquisitions.

Ultimate perfection is within the reach of those few who will not to be man, who aim not for God, and who perfect not themselves but that aspect which can endure only after its creation. This creation can take place only in Darkness: the Darkness of that which stands without, built with forces from within, They are here. They are conceptually not of mankind.
The time has come for them, and for one more genius.

The Temple of Set is specifically concerned with the Black Arts, we prefer to put I/II° Initiates in touch with others only via the introduction and personal involvement of a member of the Priesthood or via one of our Conclaves...

Ah, darkness, how I love thee! The fangs of thy sweet seduction sink deep into the mainstream of my soul. As I am transformed from a mere human existence into that of an Infernal beast; a magnificent being of omnipotent powers that art, like the very form of my existence, in constant and endless change; as I become one with my seducer, who is none but the Devil himself!

critical_analysis.relevance: This newsletter is highly relevant for understanding the internal dynamics and philosophical underpinnings of the Temple of Set in 1984. It establishes key organizational policies for Orders, reinforces the core Setian philosophy of individual self-deification (Xeper/Setamorphosis) as distinct from collective human progress, and provides practical advice for members on engaging with the Temple's resources and community. It serves as a primary source for historical and operative insights into Setian practices and worldview.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The primary target audience consists of existing members of the Temple of Set across all initiatory degrees (I° through VI°+), particularly those interested in organizational structure, personal magical development, and community engagement. It also implicitly targets potential members seeking to understand the Temple's philosophy, structure, and the nature of its 'Black Arts' practices.
